title: Access control
question: This code is valid Swift – true or false?
hint: Make sure that private properties aren't accessed from outside their struct.

wrong.reason: actualPrice is an Int and multiplying it by 2 makes another Int, but Swift won't let us assign that integer to a Double.
This attempts to set a property called people, but no such property exists.
This has a private property, so Swift is unable to generate its memberwise initializer for us.
The codeName property is marked as a string, but the code attempts to use an integer.
This has a private property, so Swift is unable to generate its memberwise initializer for us.
The initializer expects an Int but is given a String.
